channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Engineering Test Management
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Engineering Test Management

item.title: CVE-2021-20343|2024-08-03T17:37:23.719Z -- ibm -- engineering%20test%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Foundation and IBM Engineering products are vulnerable to server-side request forgery (SSRF). This may allow an authenticated attacker to send unauthorized requests from the system, potentially leading to network enumeration or facilitating other attacks. IBM X-Force ID: 194593.

item.title: CVE-2021-20338|2024-08-03T17:37:23.870Z -- ibm -- engineering%20test%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Foundation and IBM Engineering products are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 194449.

item.title: CVE-2023-43054|2024-06-04T17:26:04.846Z -- ibm -- engineering%20test%20management
item.description: IBM Engineering Test Management 7.0.2 and 7.0.3 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 267459.

item.title: CVE-2023-43054|2024-08-02T19:37:23.119Z -- ibm -- engineering%20test%20management
item.description: IBM Engineering Test Management 7.0.2 and 7.0.3 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 267459.
